clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy of Intrathecal Morphine in Patients Undergoing Open Nephrectomy

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy and the safety of the intrathecal morphine injection in the open nephrectomy.

detailed_description.textblock: The open nephrectomy is the treatment of choice for live donor kidney transplantation and renal cell carcinoma. The incision for the nephrectomy causes severe postoperative pain. A single dose of intrathecal morphine(ITM) has been used for the postoperative pain of prostatectomy, transurethral resection of the prostate and hepatectomy. The effect of ITM for open nephrectomy has not been studied. Therefore, this prospective, randomized study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of a single 50 mcg dose of ITM added to intravenous patient controlled analgesia(IV-PCA), comparing to IV-PCA alone.

primary_outcome.measure: The evaluation of pain at 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: The doctor blinded to the investigation will visit patients. The pain will be assessed at rest and at coughing using visual analogue scale.

secondary_outcome.description: The total amount of opioids (IV morphine) used for 24 hours after surgery will be recorded and compared.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the induction of anesthesia till the emergence of anesthesia, an expected average of 4 hours
secondary_outcome.description: The total amount of intraoperative opioids (IV remifentanil) will be recorded and compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: The side effects of opioids after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 72 hours after the end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Any side effects of opioids including nausea, vomiting, dizziness, sedation, headache, pruritus and respiratory depression will be recorded.

arm_group.description: The postoperative pain management includes both the intrathecal morphine injection and the intravenous patient-controlled analgesia. Demerol on demand will be injected intravenously.
The postoperative pain management includes only the intravenous patient-controlled analgesia. Demerol on demand will be injected intravenously.

intervention.description: A single injection of morphine intrathecally
The intravenous injection of morphine using the patient-controlled analgesia machine
Demerol 25 mg intravenously when pain scores more than 5.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for the open nephrectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with renal insufficiency
- Patients with coagulopathy
- History of any neurologic disorder
- History of recent infection in 2 weeks
- History of drug abuse
- Patients who cannot understand the usage of th intravenous patient-controlled analgesia
- Patients using opioids due to the chronic pain
